comment: The 1st exam gets dropped and is replaced by the 2nd exam if the test score is higher and the end of course surveys reach a certain percentage. He also let us do test corrections for test two since apparently the grades were on the lower end but I was fine. Overall I would take him again, he's nice and clearly cares for us to do well.

He wastes lectures and time on useless matters He does not teach the parts that are in homework, so you either memorize them or never learn them he forgets to address essential details Make sure to self-study and do a lot of practice on u own quiz and test are from hw and class work he is more helpful during office hr don't open ur coputer in class

He has some limitations that prevent him from getting information across well. He is knowledgeable on the topic, but his stutter and poor handwriting make it hard to obtain all information. Some days it is worse than others. He will extend assignments and other things to help the students but if you need a good lecturer avoid this course. Great guy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I think most people think Professor Jonaidi is hard to understand because of his slight stutter, but to rate his class low based off of that is unfair. His class by the nature of the material is just difficult, but this guy really cares about his students and their success. If you are patient with him,& ask questions, his class really is not hard.

Dr. Jonaidi is a great professor, he really cares about his students. Any engineering course is going to be somewhat difficult, so I wouldn't characterize this class as a walk in the park. But if you show up, ask questions, try to learn, and do the homework then you'll do fine. I would take this class again and take Dr. Jonaidi for future classes.

Professor Jonaidi truly cares about his students and the material covered in class. If you need help understanding anything he will help when he is available. Extra credit opportunities and he wants you to make a good grade in his class. Put forth the effort on homework and quizzes, you will do fine on his exams. Overall great professor.

Terrible. Never take this professor. He is the laziest professor I have ever taken. Everything was automated so he did not have to do anything, but post an assignment or see if you participated in a discussion post. He almost never knew a student's question in class. No partial credit on anything. It seemed like he did not know the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: A lot of homework. I mean a lot!!!! quiz and test are open notes on master engineering. tests are very similar to quizzes. also d2l discussion about 8-10.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I worked on a remote directed study research project with Dr. Jonaidi. I had a wonderful experience. He was always easy to reach and very patient with me! He is never hesitant to give advice or suggest alternate routes if you get stuck, but also let me follow my own path through it. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: This guy is one of the most unorganized professors ive had. Even though we were supposed to have regular class meetings, the majority of the time he just wouldn't show up to collaborate ultra and would leave the whole class waiting. He never responds to emails and would almost never update us on what we needed to do. He was a massive inconvenience.

He is caring, respectful and knows his stuff. For this course, you need a professor that to make you understand the concepts well and he explains things clearly. He goes out of his way to help you. I would take him again.

Professor writes everything he does in class online in one-note, which is saved and updated online for everyone to view at any time. Gives a few Homework problems in every other class and just about every quiz/test is very reflective homework problems. Understand homework problems/ examples reviewed in class, review these before the test, get an A
Hard to understand, when his handwriting is terrible, and he writes everything. including the tests and quizzes. He means well though.

Great teacher who legitimately cares about his students and wants them to pass. Uses online materials and OneNote very well, and you can find all notes and examples on there. Make sure you come to class and more importantly keep up on the homework, as you can fall behind in the course material very quickly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Exams and quizzes are straight from the book, but does not grade fairly. If he likes you, you will pass with an A if he doesnt know you and you are failing he will give you a C but he will not curve you one point if he doesnt like you. Changes the grading policy after the final exam without a notice doesnt really grade the hw until he feels like it

Pros: Pretty receptive to students and what they want from the class. Cons: Disorganized, will often forget homework due dates or just not mention them. He uses Onenote for 100% of his teaching which for me ended up being more confusing than helpful. Tests are unnecessarily difficult since he only gives around 60% of the equations needed for tests
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very disorganized when it comes to keeping up with assignments, quizzes, test & dates. The HW problems prepare you for tests. He even puts some HW questions on tests but with changed numbers. Lectures werent that helpful & he didnt go over enough in class examples, which is fine cause he is always at his office hours & going is very helpful.

Don't rely on his lectures, he seems to get a bit confused sometimes. However, if you do the suggested homework, you can make an A easily. Show up to class, because sometimes he gives more specific problems he wants you to focus on. Quizzes are not really kept up with very well, we only had like 3 when we were meant to have about 8.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Pretty nice guy, definitely goes out of his way to explain the material and make everyone has a concrete understanding. Almost to nice, will pretty much postpone any test if you ask him to. There isnt any homework in his classes which is nice but beware of pop quizzes every week
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough

comment: Pros: The questions on the tests are from the homework but w/different numbers Cons: He showed up very late to class a few times, one of which was a test day. He constantly changed the dates of quizzes/tests. Everyday he'd make mistakes on example problems which confused students. My advice if you must take him. Do all examples/hw from textbook

Great professor, wants everyone to pass. Gives extra credit and all questions for tests and quizzes come straight from the textbook so do his suggested problems and you'll see them again when it really matters. This was one of the classes I was scared for for ended up being one my easiest. Awesome, just awesome!

Hard to follow lectures, but the textbook he recommends is superb. About 5 in-class quizzes and around 4 take-home, replaces the lowest with a 100. 3 tests with questions that came directly from the textbook and problems he does in class. Final was pretty hard, get your grade as high as you can before taking it!

Awesome professor, lenient & understanding when it comes to student concerns. He's always willing to stay after & help you understand lecture material. He's disorganized when it comes to keeping up with quizzes/tests. The homework problems do prepare you for most of the tests. Some of the test questions were hard, but it wasn't too awful. DO THE HW

He gives alot of homework, and everything is from the book, so memorize his suggested examples, and hw problems, and its an easy class. Final project is too long, and over the top. it lacks information you need for design.

Very smart and knowledgeable just has a hard time sometimes relating/communicating the information to us. Definitely read the book thoroughly. Especially the examples and suggested problems. Hard exams but very liberal partial credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Jonaidi is the prof. that requires you to do more learning on your own. His lectures are straight from the txtbk, which he relies on heavily. He knows the material, but has a hard time conveying the message sometimes. Gives a lot of HW but doesn't grade it. He based his tests on HW and examples b/c of the lack of people doing the HW.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Wish he would grade the hw. Quizzes are very hard, and little partial credit will be given. Study all the examples from the book for exams. Also,if he writes down a concept, you better too, he'll never mention them again, and it'll be on the tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He's a great professor and really wants everyone to fully understand the material. His tests and quizzes are fair compared to what he teaches you in class.

You will love engineering if you take this prof. He really cares about the students and he make sure everyone understand the material, he stay late after class to the students, I wish he teaches other ME classes so I can take his classes, I wish all the teachers are helpful like him.

Great professor who generally cares about his students understanding the material. Stayed after class to clarify things with my and other students numerous times. Put forth effort and you will succeed. I wish I could take him for more classes. Really needs to become a part of the SPSU faculty.
Great teacher. A little scattered with assignments, but he cares about the students understanding the material, and is willing to take the time to make sure that everyone understands.
